intro: Cirsium tappeineri, commonly known as the Tappeiner's thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe, particularly in countries like Austria and Switzerland. The plant is characterized by its spiny, upright stems and large, silvery-green leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically purple or pink, forming dense clusters at the top of the plant. Cirsium tappeineri is often found in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cool, moist environments.
